attributes.action: Replace taxes on production by a Land Value Tax.
attributes.additional_details:
1) People deserve to own what they make. No one made land, so it is fairer to tax land than production.

2) Supply of production changes to suit demand, self-regulating its price. This is not true of land, which has fixed supply: By now, land is 60% of UK wealth. 70% of land is owned by 1% of the population.

3) A tax on production lowers its supply but not demand, raising its price by the amount taxed. A tax on land would lower its demand but not supply, lowering its price by the amount taxed.
attributes.background:
Reduce taxes on production such as income tax, VAT and corporation tax. Abolish taxes on buildings.

Implement a land value tax. That is, an annual tax on land ownership, but not on any man-made improvements on the land.
